overview_of_class: Guest artist Alex Benjamin (NU SoC 2015) is a Chicago-based director, writer, and drag performer. This winter, he is beginning to gather materials and approaches for a script he hopes to complete and produce in Chicago before the end of 2018. The production he imagines will include a combination of adapted and devised material, including personal narratives of the performers, to explore the relationship between drag performance and the first Oz novel by L. Frank Baum, best known through its MGM screen adaptation (1939). Paul Edwards, a faculty member in Performance Studies, is a Chicago-based director and writer, and a three-time winner of the Joseph Jefferson Award for original stage adaptations, including the script for Geoff Ryman's Oz-themed novel Was (produced by Roadworks, 1996). In 2014, Edwards mentored Benjamin's Undergraduate Research Grant work on a new play, The Zone, about the aftermath of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986; the project won the Fletcher URG Award in fall 2014. This winter's workshop class will enroll fifteen students, who will develop original performances at three points in the quarter.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
ASSIGNMENTS
1. Group performance: adaptation of a section of Geoff Ryman's novel Was (target length: 10-15 m.)
2. Solo performance: personal narrative about "friends / imaginary friends / family / home" (target length: 5-10 m.)
3. Group performance: devised script about "transformation and dreamwork" (target length: 10-15 m.)
4. Weekly response papers to reading, viewing, and performances.
5. Attendance at all classes, and participation in all course activity, are mandatory. The course also requires outside-of-class rehearsal.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
REQUIRED READING
Baum, L. Frank. The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. 1900. [Children's novel.]
Griswold, Jerry. The Classic American Children's Story: Novels of the Golden Age. 1992. [Selection.]
Harmetz, Aljean. The Making of The Wizard of Oz. Rev. ed. 1998. [Selection.]
Senelick, Laurence. The Changing Room: Sex, Drag, and Theatre. 2000. [Selection.]
Paglia, Camille. "Judy Garland as a Force of Nature." 1998. [Essay.]
Dyer, Richard. Ch. 3, "Judy Garland and Gay Men." Heavenly Bodies: Film Stars and Society. 2nd ed. 2004. [Book chapter.]
Ryman, Geoff. Was. 1992. [Novel.]
hooks, bell. "Is Paris Burning?" Black Looks: Race and Representation. 1992. [Book chapter.]
Butler, Judith. "Gender Is Burning: Questions of Appropriation and Subversion." Bodies That Matter: On the Discursive Limits of "Sex." 1993. [Book chapter.]

REQUIRED VIEWING
Fleming, Victor, et al., dirs. The Wizard of Oz. MGM, 1939. [Fiction film.]
Baum, L. Frank. The Oz Films of L. Frank Baum. 1914. Grapevine, 1994. [Selection.]
Livingston, Jennie, prod. and dir. Paris Is Burning. 1990. Miramax, 1991. [Documentary.]
Simone, Diane, et al., prod. Memories of Oz. TCM, 2001. [Selection.]
Lacy, Susan, dir. Judy Garland: By Myself. PBS American Masters, 2004. [Selection.]
